duck: A testator is a person who has written and executed a last will and testament that is in effect at the time of his/her death.
testator definition: a person who dies leaving a will or testament in force.

wiki.text:
A 'testator' is a person who has written and executed a last will and testament
that is in effect at the time of his/her death.<ref></ref> It is any "person who
makes a will."<ref name="Gordon">Gordon Brown, Administration of Wills, Trusts,
and Estates, 3d ed. (2003), p. 556. ISBN 0-7668-5281-4.</ref>
wiki.title: testator
